intro: Cotylelobium harmandii, commonly known as the Harmand's cotylelobium, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
